cv.abstract: I'm a mathematical software engineer and founder of MathSoftware, leading an approach to modern mathematics by working with computational mathematical models and strong software engineering foundations optimizing for functional programming.

entries.title: Software Engineer
entries.description: I performed SWE and ML roles to combat digital fraud on ID documents, adhering to the Y-Combinator startup culture.
items: Expanded document support using **Golang**, **Python**, and **AWS**, increasing existing coverage and extending to two new countries.
Helped maintain fraud detection above 90% and FPR below 2%. Delivered 5 object detection models for extracting ID fields.
Measured, processed datasets, fine-tuned, and experimented, with **OpenCV**, **TensorFlow**, **PyTorch**, and **DVC**.
Learned new ML/DL skills quickly, developed in-house tools, and assisted colleagues. **Jira** (**Scrum** 1-week sprints), and **Bitbucket**.

entries.title: Mathematics, Engineering Intern
entries.description: I contributed to ML/DS research and analytical client reports while developing the company website and ERP web apps. I completed a Mexican scholarship for my activities involving **Python**, **Vue.js**, **Tailwind CSS**, **SQL**, **Azure**, and **Trello (Scrum)**.

entries.title: Engineering Intern
entries.description: I built a full backend API using **Nest.js** and **AWS** for a production-ready tourism application (Virtravl) with authentication and assisted the team with operations, the **MySQL** database, and the **Vue.js** frontend.

entries.title: MathSwe
entries.description: I continually apply my mathematical and engineering expertise to modernize mathematics, upholding rigorous standards.

entries.title: Math.Software
items: [Texsydo](https://tsd.math.software): Builds my technical web articles and model visualizations, in **Kotlin** (CLIs), **JavaFX + Canvas**, **React + TS**, and **LaTeX**.
[Repsymo](https://rsm.math.software): Solves math models (OR) with granular representations I originally built to lecture, using **Angular + TS + Canvas** (PWA).
[System Ops](https://ops.math.software): Automates Linux software Ops (install, config), streamlining VM/WS setup and accelerating staff onboarding with a **Rust** CLI.

entries.title: MathSoftware.Engineer
items: [MathSoftware.Engineer](https://mathsoftware.engineer): Publishes essential works where I study, research, develop, and publish articles and PR/Release blogs.

[Slides](https://blog.mathsoftware.engineer/building-slides-from-screenshots-app-in-javafx): Enhances communication by converting code to presentations. Authored a granular blog on its development with **JavaFX** and **OCR**.
[My Page](https://me.mathsoftware.engineer): Shows a web version of my CV with the remaining details about me with **Stencil.js** (PWA).

entries.title: MathSwe.Com
items: [MathSwe.Com](https://mathswe.com): I undertake business concepts to support my OSS (forthcoming). **React**, **Jira**, **IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate**.
[MathSwe Legal](https://github.com/mathswe/legal): I designed a GDPR-compliant Cookie Consent using **React** and **Rust**. Legal docs like privacy go here allowing MathSwe operations.

entries.title: Mathematics with Computer Science Orientation, Licentiate

sections.name: Texsydo
sections.abstract: Complex domains like mathematics, functional programming (FP), and engineering demand clear communication but are frequently challenging to present, leading to a loss of funding, support, or engagement. Texsydo aims to comply with MathSwe efficiency standards for formal and productive communication by expanding FP to documentation domains.
items: Creates, builds, serves, and deploys my technical articles.
Provides domain-aware tools, like Smart Dictionaries.
Automates the standard cover images for PR and Release blogs.
Renders mathematical model visualizations.
Can provide experimental APIs to draw step-by-step specs and art.
**Kotlin** (CLIs), **JavaFX + Canvas**, **React + TS**, and **LaTeX**.

images.title: Automatic Cover Image for Development Workflow

sections.conclusion: Texsydo builds my technical web articles and model visualizations.

sections.name: Repsymo
sections.abstract: Repsymo is an applied mathematical software aiming to solve domain-specific models with granular representation standards.
items: Solves the Machine Replacement, Workforce, and Investment OR models.
Solves the Decision Making under Uncertainty model.
Renders the solutions trees and provides the steps and model conclusion to optimize the problem.
**Angular + TS + HTML Canvas** PWA.
sections.conclusion: Repsymo solves math models (OR) with granular representations I originally built to lecture at the university.

sections.name: MathSwe Ops
sections.abstract: While mathematical software requires a DSL (Domain Specific Language) to be engineering grade, these formalities require non-mathematical Special Operations to reach production.
items: The **MathSwe System Ops** CLI provides a software images to automate installation, uninstallation, reinstallation, and configuration.
The System CLI is written in **Rust** available on **Linux**.
The **MathSwe Services** Web API currently provides documentation badges for README.md files (release and project name)
Services is a **Node.js TS** app on **Cloudflare Workers**.
sections.conclusion: System Ops automates Linux software Ops (install, config), streamlining VM/WS setup and accelerating staff onboarding. The Services API implements endpoints according to demands.

sections.name: Drawing a Tree Article with EP
sections.abstract: A detailed design, development, and recursion analysis to draw a tree data structure with HTML Canvas and TypeScript are given from the solution tree feature implemented into the 2DP Repsymo Solver for the machine replacement model from the operations research field.
items: Introduces the Machine Replacement Model and incipient solution tree I initially built.
Details the development of the solutions tree.
Analyses recursion, memoization and rendering order.
Provides the EP source code and live deployment.
**TS**, **HTML Canvas**, **Computer Science**.

link.title: Drawing a Tree on Canvas with XY Coordinates

sections.conclusion: I took the solutions tree of my works on the machine replacement model and Repsymo to author a formal article on it with a step-by-step development, EP source code, and live deployment.

sections.name: Slides App with Blog and EP
sections.abstract: Efficient and quality engineering communication is a daily challenge for creating value such as specs, documentation, content, or visualizations, which are essential for professional and educative standards, which I started materializing in JavaFX via graphical slides for building domain-specific presentations based on screenshots, code snippets, and basic shapes, resulting in a blog with example project providing an in-depth development and documentation with advanced JavaFX and AI features for automation to conquer the set goals.
items: Supports building presentations from Code Snippets, CodeShots (screenshot of code), and Screenshots.
Supports captions and drawing shapes on slides.
Provides automated text selection via OCR AI.
Provides autosaving.
Permits importing images via drag-and-drop.
Utilizes a master-view-detail desktop and reactive GUI.
Supports HD and FHD resolutions
Supports syntax highlighting for many languages for Code Snippet slides.
Granular step-by-step blog of my development with EP source code.
**Java + JavaFX**, **Tesseract OCR**

link.title: Building Slides from Screenshots App in JavaFX

sections.conclusion: Slides EP enhances communication by converting code to presentations. I authored a granular blog on its development.

sections.name: MathSwe Cookie Consent and Legal
sections.abstract: The Cookie Consent service enables advanced cookie compliance to MathSwe websites and web apps. Although cookie usage will be minimal, the study and validation of its design is crucial to comply with the most demanding regulations like the GDPR. Its initial release provides the endpoint for the cookie banners to finish the compliance process by storing consent proofs.
items: Compliant with the GDPR (see Cookie Consent v0.1.0 release notes).
Consent proof system as a microservice with unique user IDs.
Customization pane with complete options beyond the banner.
**React + TS**, **Rust**.

link.title: MathSwe Legal (the frontend is currently in /mathswe.com)

sections.conclusion: I designed a GDPR-compliant Cookie Consent. Legal docs like privacy go here allowing MathSwe operations.
